value.title: Dynamic Filtering with Power BI and Analysis Services
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick answers your question about how to do this in Analysis Services Tabular and Multidimensional. Also, he adds a little bit of SQL to the mix.  Make sure to watch the previous dynamic filtering videos to understand the basics of how to do this.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EXObcA9G9Vw

value.title: Enable Power BI in Microsoft Teams for EVERYONE!
value.excerpt: Did you know you can enable the Power BI app, in Microsoft Teams, for everyone? Adam walks through how this can be done with just a few clicks. value.title: Fiddler (Web Tracing)
value.excerpt: I take a look at how to get up and running with Fiddler.  This will lead into next week's video regarding using Fiddler with Power BI.  I wanted to have a good starting point for folks that have never used it before.  Fiddler:  http://telerik.com/fiddler  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: Get your Power BI Report Server Product Key (Minute Monday)
value.excerpt: In this Minute Monday, Adam shows you how to get your Power BI Report Server product key. This will allow you to install a valid copy of Power BI Report Server.  LET'S CONNECT! value.title: How the Power BI Data Region is selected
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how the Power BI data region is selected. This is the what you see when you go to About Power BI and see "Your data is stored in". You should take care to make sure this is where the majority of users you are before anyone signs up for Office 365, Power BI or other Microsoft

value.title: Microsoft R, Data Science and Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we are joined by Buck Woody. Buck is a data scientist at Microsoft. We work together to show how you can easily visualize Microsoft R in Power BI. We use Microsoft R Open and then move onto Power BI Desktop.  The example used in Microsoft R Open is the Anscombe's quartet.   Download sample

value.title: Modify the Power BI Concatenated list of values quick measure

value.title: OData Differences within Power BI and how to refresh your data!
value.excerpt: Last week we looked at the O365 Bubble and how we use Authentication to go in and out.  This week we show it in action!  We will look at one of the limitations to the existing Power BI service and how we can actually use the new Power BI Preview service to refresh data from an OData feed using oAuth

value.title: 'OraOLEDB.Oracle' provider is not registered
value.excerpt: Highlights an issue that could occur when creating a Data Source within Power BI Admin Center.  Oracle Provider downloads -  64-bit Oracle Data Access Components (ODAC) http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/windows/downloads/index-090165.html  32-bit Oracle Data Access Components (ODAC) http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/dotnet/utilsoft-086879.html

value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs

value.title: Power BI User lookup with the gateway using Active Directory
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can use Active Directory custom attributes for the user lookup with the Power BI Gateway. This can be used for both Analysis Services mapping and the Kerberos SSO with DirectQuery connections. value.title: Slicer Restatement in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at a small feature called slicer restatement in Power BI. This feature will help you to determine what was selected in a slicer. While this feature was added back in April 2018, we are betting that most folks don't know slicer restatement.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube --

value.title: STOP refreshing a single table at a time! (Power BI Desktop)
value.excerpt: Stop refreshing one table at a time! Also, don't wait for the entire data model to finish refreshing. Refresh multiple tables within Power BI Desktop. value.title: Tooltips, tooltips, tooltips in Power BI

He walks through the DAX measure and also shows some pitfalls to look out for when it comes to filter context.  Go here for the sample DAX statement: https://guyinacube.com/2017/06/tooltips-tooltips-tooltips-power-bi/
